pr_title: Replaced _data_stream_timestamp meta field's 'path' option with 'enabled' option

timeline.message:
Replaced _data_stream_timestamp meta field's 'path' option with 'enabled' option and
adjusted exception messages.

Relates to #59076

timeline.bodyText: For me, it'd be nice to just remove this whole method validateTimestampMapping. It's a little fragile to be checking the raw JSON. And I'm not sure it adds much more confidence (users should really not be messing around with the internal _data_stream_timestamp field). I don't feel strongly about this though.
timeline.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText:
I don't think it is too fragile. If for some reason the json format changes then tests fail and this method needs to be adjusted.
I still prefer to keep this method for in the case for some unknown reason the _data_stream_timestamp field mapping doesn't get applied. There is no mechanism in place that yells when this meta field mapper isn't applied when creating a backing index of data stream.
replies.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: This works for me. I approved the PR earlier and feel it's ready to merge.
replies.author: jtibshirani
